title: East Community Associates: There's Art in Iceland?
hero_caption: Asgerdur Buadottir. Orion, 1981. Gift of Nancy and Robert D. Barton.
description:
Known for its spectacular landscape, Iceland is home to contemporary artists such as Ragnar Kjartansson and the enigmatic Björk. However, its artistic history is centuries old, from folk carving and weaving to 19th-century painting influenced by the Impressionists and rigorous Modernism. Join us for a quick dip into the island's bracing cultural climate.

Our speaker Annie Morse is an independent art educator and curator who has worked with the Art Institute of Chicago, the Hyde Park Art Center, Columbia College Chicago, and 3Arts, among many other organizations.

Following the lunch, we will host a Great Art Giveaway.

Schedule of the Day:

10:00 Registration
11:00 Lecture
12:00 Lunch

Lunch menu options: Meat and spinach manicotti or vegetarian manicotti

Registration Period: November 15, 2018–December 2, 2018

To contact the event planner, please reach out to Gerri Kotyuk at (219) 865-2383. To contact the assistant event planner, please reach out to Kathy Kotyuk at (219) 865-2383.

This Community Associates event is exclusively for current Community Associates members. Membership will be verified at the door, and refunds cannot be issued for those without a valid membership. For Community Associates events that allow guests, nonmember guests must be registered by a Community Associates member.

If you are interested in becoming a member of Community Associates, please visit artic.edu/joinnow to join both the Art Institute of Chicago and the Community Associates group of your choice.
location: Munster Center for Visual and Performing Arts, 1040 Ridge Rd, Munster, IN 46321
